html: At the very time Jehovah appoints his end-time servant, Jehovah’s current, reprobate steward—of whom Shebna is a type (vv 15-19)—is “thrust out office” and “expelled from his post” (v 19). Remiss in his role as a proxy savior, he is “dislodged” or “hewn down” (nigde‘a) and “falls” (napla), word links that identify him with the wicked of Jehovah’s people and with Babylon and its king (Isaiah 8:15; 10:33-34; 14:12; 21:9). Those who hang or depend on him are “cut off,” a word link to the wicked leaders of Jehovah’s people and to Isaiah’s Greater Babylon category (Isaiah 9:14-15; 14:22; 29:20; 48:19).
